                        BDC
http://hellhound-zorr.livejournal.com/6983.html

***NON GAMERS CAN SKIP, NONE OF THIS WILL MAKE ANY SENSE***
This entry looks like hell, but I'm just to lazy to type it again. 
Pretty good event overall. Combat heavy(big plus in my book), but kind of weak on plot, well not really weak on plot, but weak on resolution. Lots of unanswered questions and intrigue. Friday started with me trying to stop a kidnapping of another PC. The down side to this is that the kidnapper was obscenely powerful(took out most of the town before I even came at him) and I
wound up on my back. The rest of the night was much less harsh with
zombies that won't stay dead(when I kill something I want it to stay
dead damnit!!!), but eventually all the bodies were burned or cut into
pieces, so that was that.
     Saturday was pretty dull. I was told there were problems with some of the staff sleeping all day, so that was the main problem. The highlight of the weekend(although the low point for iii) was our duel. Check out his entry for the play by play, ending with a torn ligament in this ankle. I had a blast and so did he(up until the end I assume). While this was going on the staff was pushing some 14 yr. old newbie under the bus, telling him that they recognize iii as his father..... while I was running a dagger into his unconscious
chest. You can see where this is going. He knocked away the dagger and
put his sword in my face. Here's the play by play:
New Kid:"I won't let you kill him!"
Ox:"Why? Are you afraid it will deprive you the pleasure of killing him
yourself?"
NK:(takes swing at Ox)
Ox:(standing up and walking at NK)"You really don't want any of this."
NK:(looks terrified, but stays on guard)
Ox:"Just go away."
NK(still terrified, still standing there)
Ox:"Please go away."(Yes, I got to reference Capt. Jack)
NK:(backs off a little)
Ox:(Turns to see someone healing iii)"What do you want to be next?
someone:(Gets the hell out of Ox's way)
Ox:(runs iii through)
Now that's pretty cool RP and an intense situation(our fight was
INTENSE)), so what better way to continue the fun? With kingoftherotton
whispering in my ear: "Berserk"(my character has Rage issues, any
senior staff member can Berserk me at any time). Now I'm attacking all
the other players. A few make attempts to bring me down, most get the
hell out of sword range. After a few minutes Kuma(my character's
adopted brother) is able to bring me out of it and all is well again.
     Later I displayed the kind of sensitivity I am known for by telling
NK:"I watched my father die too. Gain strength from it, not weakness."
Of course I left out the the fact that I was the one who killed my
father. But nobody else knows that yet.
     Saturday night was pretty standard fare, with several new players getting taken hostage, and the BBG's wanting a different PC in exchange(a traitor). So we search the woods for an hour or so, find him, knock him out, bring him back to town, and HEY!! WHAT DO YOU KNOW!! The BBG's got tired of waiting and left. So now we have the guy they want ko'd, and they have hostages we want set free,
but now we can't find THEM! Eventually they were released, although
altered(see kingoftherotten's return pic). More zombies followed.
     After that we went into a cave to get one of 3 keys to a magical seal that had been taken from us Friday night. This involved crawling through a very tight space(fun for big guys like me let me tell you), followed by a harsh fight and the return of our key! YAY! Then we get to crawl back out....(DAMNIT!!)
     Sunday had only one thing happen, the return to the cave to rescue the
local religious leader! YAY! Back through the tunnel! YAY! We killed
the guys who took him and got to his cell and.........there was a
combination/key lock.....and one of the keys went home on Saturday
night when a player had to go home for work. GGGHHHAAAA!!!! 
Game ended then, so I guess the story continues after May 6th.
Oh, interesting side note, the New Kid under the bus, another PC killed
him when he tried to stop another killing

PURITY: 27% sex, 40% substance, 33% moral [31% total]
Well done! The higher your scores, the more "pure" you are. The lower, the more you've experienced.

This test was about done deeds, so your numbers will never climb. [It's interesting to think they all started at 100%.] But will your purity continue to fall? Will you OUTGROW or will you OUTDO your past experiences? It's up to you.


Advisory:
  • Don't date anyone if your moral purities differ by more than 30%.
  • Don't run a business with anyone if your substance purities differ by more than 40%.
  • Do be friends with someone who has less than 1/2 your sex purity. You'll enjoy their colorful company.


Note: as for the "TOTAL" purity value - that's a weighted combination of your scores, indicating what a typical purity test might say about you.



My test tracked 4 variables How you compared to other people your age and gender:
You scored higher than 35% on substance
 You scored higher than 14% on sex
 You scored higher than 13% on moral
 You scored higher than 16% on TOTAL
Link: The 3-Variable Purity Test written by chriscoyne on OkCupid Online Dating

Had a great weekend, but in true BDC style, there were plenty of hitches and ups and downs. Saturday morning rocked getting to sleep in(I usually work Saturdays)then Paula and I walked down to the T into South Station to catch a bus to NY. <12 PM>The bus ride was pretty good as bus rides go(I HATE long bus rides) I got a headphone splitter for my iPod and we just chilled. 

<4 PM>Once we got into town we walked to CBGB's which was cool. There is a gallery with all sorts of pictures and memorabilia of bands that have played there (especially the Ramones). We then hailed a cab to check into the hotel and drop our bags. This is where things start to get bad......

<5 PM>So we get to the hotel where I had booked a room 2 weeks earlier, and guess what? There are no rooms available! Apparently booking online is a bad idea, because......I don't even know because I got so pissed, but the long and short of it was "sorry, no room, good luck finding a room in NYC on Easter weekend". So we tried a few other places to no avail.

<5:30 PM>At this point there was nothing to do except make the best of things, something everybody knows I am NOT very good at, but Paula managed to keep her spirits up and mine too(not easy to do). We walked down to Times Square which was a sight to see. I had only been to NYC driving through or delivering furniture, so I had never had the chance to just be there and soak it in. It was pretty awesome.

<6:30 PM>Next we walked down to The Hard Rock Cafe'(all this walking, with luggage no less, is really getting me ready for Prophet's Fall) where we waited in line for 20 minutes, but got seated right away(after the group of 4 in front of us was told 1 1/2 hours). The hour wait for our food was much less impressive, but I guess that is to be expected on a Saturday night. Over dinner we resolved to head over to the show <8 PM>(Dropkick Murphys at Irving Plaza) and try to find anyone Paula knew so at least we could crash on someone's couch or something, but no luck there. So we hung around to sell our tix(we were only able to get rid of one, but at least we recouped some of our cash), and come up with a plan. 

The plan:find a liquor store, get some Jack and Bailey's, get on a bus, and drink our way back to Boston.<10 PM> That was a pretty good plan, and once everybody(except myself, I can't sleep on buses or planes) fell asleep the trip went by pretty quickly.

Once back home,<2 AM> my father got lost on the way to get us(in his defense, Boston does change it's streets around every week or so and he hadn't been to South Station in 2 years). To top off the night, on our way out, Paula's suitcase(one of the wheeled ones) slipped out of her hand on the way down the stairs, and took her out at the knees, bruising her knee and ankle pretty badly, but nothing got broken. So we finished our day going to sleep with an ice pack on her ankle and a bag of frozen veggies on her knee. <3:30 AM>

What a fiasco right? Probably one of the best days I can remember. We both had a blast. 

Sunday was much more low key. I made breakfast in bed, then went back to sleep until the afternoon, when we went to Paula's sister's house for Easter dinner. Then we watched a movie and had an early night.

Damn that was a novel. Happy Kate?

So yesterday morning I got up, took a shower, and realized I was running low on undrwear(laundry day). So I grabbed a pair of boxers I hadn't worn in awhile got dressed and proceeded out to clean off my car. After about a minute I had a strange sinking feeling.....my shorts had slid down in my pants and had created a sort of "thigh handcuff" effect! I had forgot to take into account that I had lost about 20 lbs and 2 pant sizes in the last few months!
    
    Now, most people would have done the sensible thing, which would have been to go back in, change and come back out. I however, am not sensible, so I got in my car, grabbed a box cutter from my glove box and while pulling out cut the offending undergarment off, throwing it out of the window as I pulled out on to the street. 
     I weep for whoever found them.

Well, it's 3 days later and I'm still in a funk. I forgot to bring any movies to work so I've seen Shreck 2 4 times in a row tonight. Earlier we were listening to From the Cradle by Eric Clapton, one of the few CDs I have that is appropriate for store listening, but having played it 7 times, I'm sick of that too. I don't know, I'm just stuck in a rut I guess. DAMNIT!! There's that fucking Fairy God Mother again! And she's still singing. I can't wait to get to my car where Slipknot 3 awaits me, via-iPod, for my speeding pleasure.
http://hellhound-zorr.livejournal.com/2542.html

Well, my plans for a fun Saturday night were crashed by promising my Dad I would "move a few things" to the basement for him, turned into move THE ENTIRE FUCKING CONTENTS OF MY LIVING ROOM into the basement. What else sucks is everyone waiting around for me and then not showing up, but I'm no fun to be around when I'm grumpy, so I just went home and locked myself in my room. I probably made too much of nothing, but I had a shitty day at work, and had to work 2 hours late Saturday before I even got to my parent's house. Jesus Christ, I sound like a fucking 16 year old on this rant, but it's too early on Sunday, and I need to get some Caffine or Taurine or something else to boost me now but probably shorten my natural life span. Chlorine? Aquamarine?(mmm crunchy)And you don't even want to know about hte fucked  up dreams I've been having. Some shit is just better left unsaid.

2 hours later and still no Red Bull. I thought I heard Elves telling me to get married and began to panic, until I realized my boss bought "The Santa Clause 2" and put it in the DVD player just to torture me. He says he's sick of "Return of the King", and that is just not right.
http://hellhound-zorr.livejournal.com/949.html

Another day at the shack. There is no Red Bull to be found anywhere, and without Taurine I'm pretty much a zombie at work. At the moment the only thing keeping me alive is the Trans-Siberian Orchestra, and the fact I am only working 9 hours instead of my usual 15. 
     On a plus note, last night's party was a kick-ass time(up until the end), stories were told, songs were sung, gifts were exchanged, and the God of Scorpion Bowls and Mai Tais was appeased. I even showed uncommon wisdom by not adding whiskey to my Bailey's shots :-)
